Computer Graphics Programming Assignment
  • Question Twenty
  • View page source

Question Twenty

Write a library of functions that will allow you to do geometric programming. Your library should contain functions for manipulating the basic geometric types (points, lines, vectors) and operations on those types, including dot and cross products. It should allow you to change frames. You can also create functions to interface with WebGL so that you can display the results of geometric calculations.

GeometricLibrary Class

class GeometricLibrary

A class for handling geometric transformations.

Variables:

current_frame (np.ndarray) – Current transformation matrix.

__init__()

Initialize the GeometricLibrary object.

translate(dx, dy)

Translate the current frame by the given delta values.

Parameters:

  • dx (float) – Delta value for x-axis translation.

  • dy (float) – Delta value for y-axis translation.

rotate(angle)

Rotate the current frame by the given angle.

Parameters:

angle (float) – Rotation angle in degrees.

scale(sx, sy)

Scale the current frame by the given factors.

Parameters:

  • sx (float) – Scaling factor for x-axis.

  • sy (float) – Scaling factor for y-axis.

transform_point(point)

Transform a 2D point using the current frame.

Parameters:

point (list) – 2D point [x, y].

Returns:

Transformed point [x’, y’].

Canvas Class

class Canvas

A class for creating an interactive canvas for geometric visualization.

Variables:

  • library (GeometricLibrary) – Instance of GeometricLibrary for transformations.

  • point (list) – 2D point for visualization.

__init__(library)

Initialize the Canvas object.

Parameters:

library (GeometricLibrary) – Instance of GeometricLibrary.

initUI()

Initialize the canvas UI.

paintEvent(event)

Paint event handler for drawing on the canvas.

create_slider_group(slider, label_text, min_value, max_value)

Create a slider group for controlling geometric transformations.

Parameters:

  • slider (QSlider) – Slider widget.

  • label_text (str) – Text for the slider label.

  • min_value (int) – Minimum value for the slider.

  • max_value (int) – Maximum value for the slider.

Returns:

QWidget representing the slider group.

handle_slider_change(value, transformation_type)

Handle slider value changes and update the canvas accordingly.

Parameters:

  • value (int) – Slider value.

  • transformation_type (str) – Type of geometric transformation (translation, rotation, scaling).

WebGLViewer Class

class WebGLViewer

A class for creating a simple PyQt5 window with a button to open a WebGL viewer.

Variables:

  • webgl_button (QPushButton) – Button to open the WebGL viewer.

  • webgl_url_label (QLabel) – Label displaying the URL of the WebGL viewer.

__init__(vertex_shader, fragment_shader)

Initialize the WebGLViewer object.

Parameters:

  • vertex_shader (str) – Vertex shader code.

  • fragment_shader (str) – Fragment shader code.

setup_ui()

Set up the UI components.

open_webgl_viewer()

Open the WebGL viewer in the default web browser.

create_webgl_page(vertex_shader, fragment_shader)

Create the HTML page for the WebGL viewer.

Parameters:

  • vertex_shader (str) – Vertex shader code.

  • fragment_shader (str) – Fragment shader code.

main()

Main function to demonstrate the WebGLViewer class.

Returns:

None
